page.title: 03Nempnett Thrubwell in 1985
page.content: To the young people today Nempnett Thrubwell is still somewhat "ancient", the population being mostly middle- aged or elderly. There are very few amenities and almost no entertainment. The Mobile Library calls once in two weeks and there are coach trips in the summer and a weekly coach service to Bristol. There is no shop, pub or Post Office but a good delivery service from shops in neighbouring villages. For some, however, the area is an idyllic haven. For fishermen, bird- watchers, artists, and all who enjoy peaceful solitude it an ideal escape place. There are some signs of change - for better or worse. A number of cottages have been bought, modernised and converted for occupation by professional people and/or commuters. There is a very posh pig unit being built on the site of an old quarry.
